proviso.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a condition that you ask for before you will agree to something
proviso.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The money was given to the museum with the proviso that it should be spent on operating costs.
proviso.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a part of a contract that covers a particular subject
proviso.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Landlords frequently include a proviso stating that nothing contained in the lease shall prevent them from carrying out work on their property.
proviso.translation[1].definitions[1].de: something that must happen before you will agree to something
proviso.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: The only proviso is that you should let the office manager know well in advance if you decide to take a day off.
Some companies are happy to invest in community projects, with the proviso that the government does not neglect its own duty.
